title: Failed transactions in 1-1 chat displays as ''Confirmed" on TX sender side
body:
**_Type_**: Bug **_Summary_**: When a transaction is sent to contact with follow up `/send` message in 1-1 chat (sending from 1-1 chat/Wallet to the contact) but initial transaction eventually fails, - the message in 1-1 chat reflects it as "Confirmed" on transaction sender side (and 'TX not found' on a recipient side). #### Expected behavior Failed transactions in 1-1's chat /send message displays with the `Failed` red status and `!` icon (same as in transaction history for failed tx) indicating about failed transaction in 1-1 chat #### Actual behavior Failed transactions in 1-1 chat displays as ''Confirmed" on TX sender side ![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8749671/44664167-223c0d80-aa1b-11e8-9a8b-7e103f92f0c1.png) ### Reproduction * Open Status on Device1 and Device2 and create Contact1 and Contcat2 respectively * Contact1 gains ETH and HND in Ropsten network (user SimpleDapp in Ropsten to get assets) * Contact1 adds Contact2 in contcats * Contact1 navigates to `Wallet` -> `Send Transaction` * Contact1 selects: Contact2 as recipient; HND is Asset; Valid amount > 0 (e.g. 23) * Contact1 in Advanced Fee screen changes Gas Limit to '25000' and hit `Done` * Contact1 signs transaction * Both contacts navigate to 1-1 chat. Because Gas Limit is < the one required for HND transaction will fail. * Both contacts verify the status of the `/send` message in 1-1 chat ### Additional Information * Status version: Develop 0.9.26, Release 0.9.25 * Operating System: Android and iOS In the steps above, on the first place, we have to validate such transaction on TX fee step (i.e. validate Gas Limit). That's correct, but it is separate issue https://github.com/status-im/status-react/issues/4569 #### Logs All scenario above represented for Contact1 (check last 20 seconds to see TX and status) https://app.testfairy.com/projects/4803622-status/builds/8569241/sessions/4399555866/?accessToken=A/AKjIxCkddoGBcY08AxYC5GbRY
TestFairy: Status 0.9.26 (6640) @2018
I suggest to give it at least medium-severity.
Updated severity.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
Medium severity, still untouched.
let's do a bounty, it is easy to reproduce and it is well-specified

Issue Status: 1. **Open** 2. Started 3. Submitted 4. Done

Checkout Gitcoin Help or the Gitcoin Slack * $43,523.99 more funded OSS Work available on the [Gitcoin Issue Explorer](https://gitcoin.co/explorer)
@Serhy Is this still available?

@pbteja1998 yes, issue still valid with 0.11.0 develop build. 
As originally described: transaction sender sees 'Confirmed' on the transaction which failed.

Hi @Serhy Can you help me in setting up the codebase locally and point me where the relevant code is?

Till now I followed the instructions in [this link](https://status.im/build_status/). Everthing installed successfully. 

I want help with how to start the app? and it would also be helpful if you can point me to the relevant code related to this issue?

Thanks.
Also, can you please approve me to work on this issue?

@StatusSceptre could you please approve @pbteja1998 for work on this issue?


@pbteja1998 I think this is the place from where you can start looking on the issue: https://github.com/status-im/status-react/blob/496f3f1cc78703c3d629f9f458a0e966b04e5c61/src/status_im/chat/commands/impl/transactions.cljs#L190
Where have you stopped in setting up the environment? 
For me works successfully setting up app build with genymotion following https://status.im/build_status/ guide:
1) Start `Android 8` genymotion virtual machine (in my case)
2) In terminal -> `make shell` ->  `make startdev-android-genymotion`
3) Second teminal window -> `make shell` -> `make react-native`
4) `make prepare-android` and then `make run-android`
@Serhy Genymotion is a paid product, isn't?

@pbteja1998 They have 'Trial' option to use
Well it's not the only way you can set up an app. You can go with any of:

```
make startdev-ios-simulator
make startdev-ios-real
make startdev-android-avd
make startdev-android-genymotion
make startdev-android-real

```
Is @pbteja1998 still working on this? I might want to take over if not.
@Serhy, is @pbteja1998 still working on this issue?  I will approve him if so, if not i'll let @krisc start on it.
@StatusSceptre I have stopped working on this issue through gitcoin more than a week ago.
@pbteja1998 thank you for the update, @krisc do you want to pick this up?
@StatusSceptre  Yep, just applied!
